Reviews.Title: “Dirty but cheap”
Reviews.Author: lieumoon
Reviews.Content: We had a family room, one queen and one single bed. It was an old room with a television, small refrigerator ( not really working) and the smallest bathroom ever! You can shower while sitting on the toilet. Small, dirty but cheap. Don't look under the beds! We booked this hotel because when we are in Singapore we are hardly in our hotel so I would recommend this hotel to everybody who needs about 4 hours sleep a night and a nice warm shower. Free internet and breakfast is included... didn't had time to check it out. Great location, walking distance to the underground, lots of restaurants nearby and a 24hrs mega mall across the road.

Reviews.Title: “No star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alibaba321
Reviews.Content: Single room is terrible . There is no room to keep the bag even . Rooms are not very clean . I was charged 90 sin dollar per single room . Never book this hotel online . You don't get any confirmation of what you have booked . Only they confirm is that you have booking . You land to the hotel . They give what's avilable .

Reviews.Title: “DIRTIEST HOTEL AND RUDE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: unluckyone
Reviews.Content: to all travel hunters, i would suggest never ever consider aspinals hotel (formerly claremont hotel), it was so disappointing upon entering the room. my gosh, i was barefoot when i notice that the floor was so dusty, i think they never vacuumed a long time, the bed, the blanket was so smelly, the window, the dresser, the toilet was totally dirty. mine you, am not that kinda meticulous that much, am a cowgurl considering i love travelling, secondly, they got this front desk smoker and funky rude. terrible experience,

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Stark86
Reviews.Content: This hotel situated in front of the well-known Mustapha Center. Very good location to find place to eat and to see. But the hotel room was poor, lack of cleanliness, dusty, with hard-rock bed. The good point of this hotel was the breakfast, I enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here, even if you they pay YOU!”
Reviews.Author: iloveerasmus Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and it was possibly the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The key to my door was not working and they wouldn't change the room so we had to get the receptionist to come up and open the door everytime we wanted to get in. The paint was coming off the walls and the TV was broken. What´s more, the TV was broken, the breakfast was terrible and at 7am in the morning there was a big carnival of Indians outside my door preventing me from sleeping. The curtains were almost transparent and blocked out almost night light after dawn. The worst thing is that I paid €50 a night for this! What a joke of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!! The streets and corridors of Singapore are much cleaner!!”
Reviews.Author: wwadventurer
Reviews.Content: Aspinal website is misleading! Other 2 star hotels for the same rates have offered clean rooms and their websites are genuine. Walk in customers have their choice for a last minute, but online customers are certainly been cheated. Receptionist very rude! When asked to clean the room and the bed sheet, she replied room cleaning only 3 days once. Yucks!!! I had to spread my shawl to sleep. Very small room with cockroaches crawling on the bed, walls and the miserable cupboard is only for show piece cant be used. I was awake killing cockroaches and the previous guest had left wall marks. Very thin see through curtains, had no privacy. Bathroom stinks. Hot kettle and cups were not clean in the room. I decided to quit my breakfast at their cafe. It was a 1 night nightmare!!!! I guess, the Management is aware with all complaints and trauma guests encounter, but is not bothered to make changes.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE AND DISGUSTING HOTEL!!! WORST I'VE EVER SEEN!”
Reviews.Author: Sina2011
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have ever seen and that is quite surprising regarding that it is located in Singapore, one of the cleanest places in the world. We booked with Agoda.com and when we got there, they didn't have our booking even though we had our confirmation in hand. We had to wait about 45 mins in a lobby that was not just dirty but also didn't smell very good. The staff was very rude and unhelpful - NOT what you want after all day of traveling. We finally got a room and went up in the elevator that I was afraid to breathe and I thought it can't get worse, but it did : the room was so small that our luggage didn't even fit in. It had no window and reminded a bit of jail. It smelled awful, everything was dirty, the tv wasn't working, the A/C wasn't working, the bathroom was a hole in the wall with a toilet seat that was moldy. After looking at the room, we left instantly, there is no way anyone should have to sleep in a room like that! The manager was the rudest person I have ever seen. We later wrote a letter to Agoda.com, and thank god they refunded the money back to us, I guess it wasn't the first time that they had customers who weren't happy with this hotel. I understand that it is not a 5 star hotel and it is a budget place and we weren't expecting it to be that nice, but ANY hostel in Singapore would be better than this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “the worse place i have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: travellerswansea_11
Reviews.Content: My review pretty much echoes the previous ones. We booked on line, and the pictures shown on their website are clearly not reality! As it was a one night stop at Singapore inbetween flights, we did not have the time or energy not to accept on arrival. As we were booking in, I used the toilet in the foyer. It was absolutely stinking with the toilet and floor looking like it had not been cleaned for months. Hotel staff were very unhelpful and unwelcoming. We went in a lift up to our rooms-that also looked like it needed a good clean! The rooms were dark and dingy, very basic and also felt unclean. There was a hole in our room, which had been covered in tape and the wall 'rocked' when you touched it! Our friend didn't even have a window in his room-in short both rooms were a right dive. Lots of courage needed to face breakfast/coffee in the morning. Leads missing off kettles and tv's not working in rooms-beware and steer clear of this place!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel i've stayed!”
Reviews.Author: boompee
Reviews.Content: Rude staff very old & small elevator small & dirty room worst breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice hotel”
Reviews.Author: butterfly1818
Reviews.Content: Room was small, too small for comfort.. bathroom was small too, water spills out from bathroom because the shower was too near the door.. causing the floor outside to be 'flooded'.. The reception people were not too friendly, no smiles on their faces and carry that "you want you take it attitude".. The code on the door card changes everyday, so before going up to your room go to the reception counter for a new code.. didnt know about this and for 2 days i had to go up and find out that my card could not open my door then go down again to get a new code.. what a hassle.. The housekeeping people only made up the bed.. and do not tidy much of the room.. towels were bad.. there was one towel which had a hole on it, with a diameter of about 6cm.. Don't be shocked by the rude housekeeping call outside your room door, every morning about 11am.. one man will come round shouting outside your door, either telling you about housekeeping or askiing you to check out.. not professional at all.. Parking space is difficult to find even late at night, due to the Mustaffa Shopping Centre which opens 24 hours a day.. Will never go back to this hotel again and will not recommend it to anyone..

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping on the street would have been cleaner”
Reviews.Author: Ludmillatravellers
Reviews.Content: Was booked into Aspinals by Agoda as original choice was not available. Arrived after a 12 hour trip from Istanbul via Malaysia. On arrival the staff member provided us a double room as opposed to the triple room even though that was what I paid for. Their reasoning was that I had identified only two adults - I had two adults and one 12 yr old and my husband was only staying the day we needed three beds. Did not argue as very very exhausted on entering the room the it was small pokey, there was dust and dirt in the corners of the room. The rooms did not look like they had been properly vacuumed in 6 months. The window did not open to allow fresh air as it a hotel that allows smoking. Even the reception area was very very smelly. We stayed one night only as we could not get a reimbursement for the night. When I complained about the smell, it was ignored. The included breakfast was in a downstairs room called the basement. The breakfast on offer was what looked like to be chicken nuggets cereal and toast. the breakfast area also smelt bad. After this overnight stay stay in the morning, I quickly packed and my son was violently ill. Vomiting all over the place. On leaving I told the reception staff that their hotel was the worst I had ever stayed in and I work in remote Northern Territory Aboriginal communities and have seen very rough accommodation. It was criminal that the Singaporean Government allows such substandard hotel to exist. Further to this, the it is widely accepted by the taxi drivers that most foreigners stay one night and find another hotel in the following day.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, poor variety of breakfast but good location”
Reviews.Author: gautammasand
Reviews.Content: I had actually booked myself for Ambassador Hotel-which is part of the same Hotel group..........when I reached there I was told that I did nt have a booking......Wow ! The lady at the help desk (of Ambassador) made a couple of calls and finally informed me that my booking was for Aspinale....which was 2 minutes walk.....I was quite shocked. Nevertheless,we left our bags at the lobby (inside a store room) and proceeded for breakfast ...as it was around 9 AM, as we had landed at around 7.30 AM. Around 9.30, we proceeded to Asipnals and requested for an early check-in....to our surprise we got the room at 10 AM, which wasactually very kind of them !!! we entered into a small cramped room,just enough to fit us in, and few bags on top of each other........we had taken a triple sharing room...........I had paid almost USD 90 per night with breakfast which I felt was alot ,....but being Singapore Independence on the 9th August we had to pay a surcharge.......though the hotel did not seem full at all.like most other hotels in Singapore where u need to pay an exhibition surcharge, wherea the hotels dont ever seem full !!! wecould not switch on the TV set at all, after trying like a dozen times and finally gave up on it. The air conditioning was good........the beds were ok The breakfast was very very limited........ there was jam bread,, juice, bled egg and some new Indian dish every morning (we stayed 3 nights there) There was also only 1 type of juice all days.....not very exciting !!! The location wasthe only saving grace, as I could see Mustafa shopping from my window and the Farrer Park MRT Station was only around 4-5 minutes walk. the bathroom seemed clean but cramped but had running hot water always ( I dont use cold water even in summers--habit !!!) So I can saw that only location is the good part, but also we wer kind enough to get an early check- in and the a/c was good-got real sound sleep after a long long day...... so I wont complain too much................but I yet do believe that We paid alot more than what its actually worth (try getting this on a non-event day it would be less....ok-ok for real budget travellers.,,,,,,,so I would still recommend this, as we were often greeted with smiles of staff who themselves seemed to be knowing that things may not be better there .....and sorry for chosing to stay with us.....try and enjoy !!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever! For the price you pay...”
Reviews.Author: Aftrbrn
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel ever! For the price you pay, its a definite rip off. The rooms are disgusting, the sheet is dirty, the towel is 15 yrs old and the lounge looks like a canteen. The reception also looks like everyday is a miserable day. I dreaded going home to the hotel but Ive already paid and it was a BIG mistake! Never ever going to come back!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! Beware of this place!!”
Reviews.Author: TzDenise
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine came all the way from Kuching, Msia had no idea that this hotel is so bad. He booked online and pay USD68 for this terrible room! He invited us to see his room and we all got a shocked!! I can never imagine this conditions of the room can be found in a place like S'pore. This poor friend of mine literally cry when he checked in. He told us he is not going to sleep in the room and he will spend his whole night at a nearby 24 hours cafe/stall. We took him out of the place and check him in to another more decent hotel. For the same price , Fragrance and Hotel 81 are way better than this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Indian version of Fawlty Towers except worse”
Reviews.Author: chrislangnz
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere nice to stay on our first night in Singapore. We booked and paid for a room online for a last minuite deal of $140 at The Claremont Hotel. On arrival at the hotel they announced they had no more room and we were told to go to the Aspinal down the road. After the difficulties of checking in there they finally gave us the key card to our room. Obviously the room had not been made up after the previous guest - the bed was unmade, and towels on the floor etc. Luckily we were sent to a different room but were appalled at the state of this room. There were holes in the wall, the main light did not go, and it was dirty and cramped. We mentioned as we were checking in how much we paid online for a room and could not believe what we got for our money. The overall service and conditions of the room were exceptionally poor. I hated it so much - yuck dirty filthy hole! I wouldn't even dream of sending my worst enemy there. Even Basil Fawlty would be disgusted. Would have rather stayed in a tent over the gutter.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel...Please do not book your stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bennysalam
Reviews.Content: I was booked Claremont Hotel in Seragon Hotel through Agoda (agent) and when I went there for check-in they said that all the rooms are full. Remember that I had a reservation confirmed by the hotel. They have directed to me to Aspinals Hotel in Syed Alwi Road which is inside of Little india area. I have reached the hotel by 10:00pm. The receptionist (an Old Gentleman from India) does not know even how to smile!!!! He has put me in a room and the room facilities are extremely bad and not at all same as the pictures shown in their website. I had no other choice but to accept that. I have stayed for 2 nights and checked-out. I requested the same receptionist to help me to book a taxi through telephone. He said that he require SGD 5.00 for booking. I said that I will pay SGD 10.00 but need a receipt. Then he said that it will be very difficult to get the taxi through telephone booking due to rush hour on Friday. It reveals that the money he asked is for his pocket. I would recommend NOT to stay in this hotel even if you could not find a room anywhere in Singapore. It is better to spent night in some shopping malls if you could not find any hotel other than Aspinals.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Terrible Hotel I've ever stayed in! >.<”
Reviews.Author: HongKongVanessa
Reviews.Content: I'm planning my next trip to Singapore at the end of 2010, so that I have to search for updated information about accommodation in Singapore. When I saw the name of this terrible hotel again (I stayed for 1 night during my travel to Singapore in 8/2007), it urged me to note down the worst hotel stay experience here to alert those tourists who maybe cheated by its homepage photoes！ The wallpapers were torn off, mattress dirty and being bite by unknown name insects, shower was out of order and the tubing of shower head was broken！！！Bad smell room....... How can it be named as a hotel? A hotel that drives tourists crazy！

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Terrible Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: D3vilicious
Reviews.Content: Me and my BF just wanted a place to rest and spend time together during the eve of Deepavali. We didnt want to go to Geylang for its sleazy area and no nightlife and chose Little India instead with the intention of dropping by late night shopping at the 24hrs Mustafa Center. I try booking online but everything was a mess so instead i call up Aspinal but got transferred to Claremont instead. When I told the mean receptionist that I want Aspinal , she mentioned that I should say it clearly during the first call!! (WTH) Spoke to the unfriendly Receptionist at Aspinal and eventhought the price started $80 per night, she was willing to give us only $70. (Early bird rate perhaps but i book in the morning before i check in in the evening on the same day) The location is good but it get noisy and rowdy at night. The hotel was a total dump. We were given room 308 but because of the bad smell and spoilt aircon, we had to change to another room 409.. No telephone in the room, only 2 channels for the tv, fridge with no electricity, canned drinks that looks it have been there for years, No hot water to bath in. Terrible Terrible.. Good thing we stayed in that tiny room only for 1 night!!

Reviews.Title: “Close down this hotel now!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yasar0777
Reviews.Content: My advise to you, don't stay at this hotel. Just because they are cheapest they think they can provide you terrible service. When I first arrived at 8pm it was so dark at the reception because they are trying to save electricity. I told the unfriendly recptionist that I booked online only two days before and didn't have my print out reservation. She then called "the manager" on her mobile and I was told I need to have the reservation printed out. I asked her if I could use her computer check my email and show the reservation, but she said we don't have Internet (which I found hard to believe) and I would have to use the Internet cafe down the road. I had no choice and had to find the internet cafe to check my email and print the reservation as I was so tired and had an early morning flight the next day. I just needed a place to sleep. She then asked me to pay upfront!!!!!!!!! I didn't have any Singapore dollars and told her that I would pay later. But the room was a [--] house!!!!!!! No phone (their website says rooms have phone), tiny room, bed sheets and quilt cover looked stained and dirty, the bathroom shower was nearly over the top of the toilet. The room was more like a prison cell. Take my honest advice don't stay there and avoid it at all cost. Its better to pay double and stay at a standard hotel. THIS PLACE HAS NO IDEA ABOUT RUNNING A HOTEL BUSINESS.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ForFamily
Reviews.Content: I wont even bother rating this hotel. They mustn't even advertise the hotel! It's not clean, NO HOT WATER!!!!!! Noisy and just awefull. Not family friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever and PLEASE do not go there”
Reviews.Author: Asiatravellers_8
Reviews.Content: Its a dump, staff is more then unfriendly, continetal breakfast is non existing, you have cold fries and some rice thing, eating from plastic plates, plastic forks, plastic cups, instant coffee, not hot water, only 3 tv chanels, doors dont lock or worse doors dont open, do I need to say more?

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful”
Reviews.Author: Seytraveller
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked 4 nights but thankfully I stopped him from paying in advance on the day we checked in, and we could check out the next day. It thoroughly spoilt our holiday and we were actually so traumatised that we decided to leave Singapore two days early. We actually walked around and found the Ambassador Hotel just round the corner, which ironically is Aspinals sister hotel. it was much better with a proper bathroom, but still clearly a budget hotel. THe Aspinals room was the tiniest room I have ever seen and the bathroom was depressing. There was no mirror, the room smelled funny, the shower was directly overhead the toilet i.e. there was no shower cubicle. Can you imagine the hygiene implications here? We did not get any sleep until 3am because of an extended Indian family who had seemed to have taken 2 rooms either side of us. One kept singing (the walls are paper thin) and the others kept running in and out of their rooms. The guests also think it is acceptable to leave their doors open and carry excessively loud conversations in the corridor all night. There was even a toddler who carried on until the early hours. If you can imagine we were a weary couple just arrived from a 10 hour flight, the next morning we bid adieu to this most horrifying hotel and found another. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. IT IS DIRTY, SMELLY, UNCOMFORTABLE and Downright shameful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst of the worst”
Reviews.Author: fayyong
Reviews.Content: Worst Nightmare in my life! Booked by a fren..very near to Mustafa shopping centre. Its about 70-80SGD a nite if im not mistaken.. It looks ok outside but when u step in you'll smell some mould..reception was a bit torn...only one lift..i just hate the carpet mouldy smell until u get into ur room.. Room was SUPER small..bed frame was like a metal frame and the sheets was stink..EW...the toilet was TOO SMALL to even turn ur body..one small window overlooking the back alley..Noisy~The Fridge was on the floor! Old lousy fridge and the cups stains... Nearest MRT was Farrer Park..which is about 15 min walking.. We move out the next day and luckily they return the money for us..when i was at the New seventh storey hotel..it was heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: royalsue
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in,in my life. What a disgrace. I have stayed in Singapore before and every time the hotel has been wonderful. This was disgusting. First of all, the taxi driver had no idea where the hotel was. Then when we found it, the reception and dining area were separated by a piece of hanging rag. Firstly, the corridors stunk of mould. Then to open the door of the room and be confronted by what we saw. Holes in the wall, floor and ceiling. Parts of the ceiling falling down. stains on the floor from what I cannot bear to think of. The bathroom was so small the shower was literally over the bath. The curtain was a piece of stained material flapping against the window. The restaurant, such as it was, offered fried rice and samosas as the breakfast. Other patrons were sitting around barefoot with their feet on the chairs picking their toes and eating their meals. This gives you some idea of the clientele. The photos on the website bear absolutely no resemblance to the real thing. I have just returned from my trip to check the Internet to see if I made a mistake. No I didn't. How dare they say these lies. Fortunately for us this was just a transit stop but don't book a holiday here.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in China Town instead”
Reviews.Author: oozingrich
Reviews.Content: Electrical wires hanging out the wall. Layer of water on the floor after house keeping 'cleaned' the room. The rooms are small but you get what you pay for. The maintanence and hygene in the rooms is inexcusable. Locked fire exit and faulty fire alarm system. The location was ok and the room was so feril that it did motivate us to stay out and about longer! I would stay cheap backpackers rather than here again. The staff were nice enough and the mustufa shopping centre across the road is excellent. 5 minute brisk walk to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad Hotel ever in my life time...”
Reviews.Author: budgetT
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with accomline.com website and got very disappoint with this hotel ... 1. smell bad all the way from Lobby to your room...Don't look over this point smell bad can ruined your trip believe me 2. Not that close to MRT about 10 -15 minute walk for Asian legs... 3. The room is very small 4. They charged u for a drinking bottle while other Hotel give it for free 5. Small Bath room and after shower outside = wet wet wet 6. My friends room TV and Telephone breakdown and they don't even care to send anyone to fix it... 7. Too bad for anyone trip ...eventhough I'm a long time budget traveller but this Hotel give me a bad experience....

Reviews.Title: “worst stay ever”
Reviews.Author: manila_travel_girl
Reviews.Content: please do not book in this hotel if you don't want your vacation to be spoiled. when i arrived in the hotel, i literally felt like crying. the room rates of the hotel is cheap but it still feels like wasting money. the rooms are small, the walls have holes, there is no window in the basic room, the carpets stink, the beds are stiff, the toilet are tiny... the whole place from the lobby to the rooms smell like spices. the smell will even stick to your clothes. breakfast was really unpredictable. there was bread and jam and milk and no hotdogs or anything else. you wouldn't think you are in singapore when you stay here. PLEASE BOOK WITH ANOTHER HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Avoidable Pigeon-hole Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellerdna
Reviews.Content: We had intended to stay here for 9 days in the Christmas-Newyear 2006 but made a desperate run after 4 days. Due to the peak holiday season, we couldn't find a room in a new hotel fast enough and ended up suffering 4 days. Firstly, let's start with the location - Syed Alwi Road in Singpore - this is THE busiest street in Little India due to Mustafa Centre. Its absolutely crowded and there's no space to walk anywhere - neither pavements nor the road. And its dirty. So, if you are in Singapore for a vacation, give any hotels on this road a wide berth. The Aspinals is right opposite Mustafa Centre entrance. And if you stay here, you'll never EVER realize you were in Singapore... 98% of people you see are Indians, Bangladeshis, Srilankans et. all. The Hotel itself has a nice wooden Swiss style lobby. But that about ends there. You are greeted by moustached Indian Punjabi ladies whose english communication skills are limited to "You have to pay XX Dollars" and "Your Room No. is XX". Any other query is met with blank stares...maybe zombies are cheap to hire or something. We paid S$89 for the Double Room, including taxes and breakfast (tea, bad juice, bread, butter, jam ONLY). But when we saw the room, I ran on down and asked them again if I'd gotten a Single Room or something. The Rooms are really pigeon coops - the size that we saw in Star Cruise Virgo - I would estimate the rooms are just 3x3.5 or less. The bathroom is double the size of an Airline Toilet - yes, it really is that small. Sort of extends your Economy class flying experience to your Hotel. There are NO TAPS in the bathroom, only a wall mounted shower and there is NO WATER MIXER. What that means is that you get Scalding Hot water one second and Cold water the next. It takes fine tweaking of the 2 controls just to set the temperature right everytime. And since the bathroom is so small, my wife accidentally knocked the shower tap while walking in and got scalded with hot water. She was going into the Bath to put on lipstick because besides the 8" inch mirror there, there is NO MIRROR in the room. So, if your wife/girlfriend was planning on going out looking decent, combing their hair etc. then tough luck - there is only one mirror in the Bath. The Bath itself is about 1m x 0.8m size and that includes the WC, Bathing area and Washbasin. There is one small (really small) cupboard and one study table in the room. That leaves no space to keep your luggage because it sure as hell does not fit in the tiny cupboard. Traversing the room itself is interesting because 2 people cannot walk around at the same time. There is space for ONLY ONE one normal sized person to walk around at one point of time. Housekeeping was daily and we didn't believe it until we were there on 2 days to experience the housekeeping routine. It takes less than 5 minutes for housekeeping to cleanup and after that you really don't notice that they did do the job. If we hadn'twitnessed the event, we wouldn't believe anyone did housekeeping at all. The TV was included but I wonder why since there was no cable - just a few local channels in the local language. The hotel is located in Little India but the management expects tourists to understand the local Singaporean language, hence no English channels. Breakfast was a joke and we didn't expect it otherwise. There was some bad quality orange juice, tea, jam, bread, butter and cornflakes. No, there was no other cereal - just cornflakes. We tried the breakfast the first day, then didn't bother after that. Anyway, we tried but couldn't find alternate accomodation due to peak season. When we finally did, we ran out smiling. And the happy ending - the hotel we finally got CLASSIQUE HOTEL was a pleasure and a great find. Its on the edge of Little India and just about 500 meters from Aspinals Hotel. And it costs just S$70. Read my review on that hotel here on Tripadvisor.

HotelInfo.Name: Aspinals Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 83 Syed Alwi Road, Singapore 207 662, Singapore
